name: Rachael

topics.response_text: You're my hero, ma'am. I want to be just like you when I grow up.

topics.topic_text: I think I get the idea. Let me ask you something else.
Don't worry. I'm just here to play Republic with you.
topics.response_text: I like playing Republic. Even though stupid Ralphie always gets to play as Dave!

topics.topic_text: I think I'd like to meet Dave.
topics.response_text: Okay, I'll take you, but President Daddy doesn't always like new people.

topics.topic_text: I'm just a wanderer. I'll be going now.
topics.response_text: Strangers need to stay outside or get permission from President Daddy! Else the Army of Dave will shoot you!

topics.topic_text: I'm not here to hurt anyone. What is this place?
topics.response_text: This is the Republic of Dave, duh! It's named for President Daddy! But you have to talk to him if you want to stay here.

topics.topic_text: Um... I don't think so. I'll stay out here.
topics.response_text: Okay. Just don't hang around the fence. President Daddy's guards don't like that.

topics.topic_text: Wait, who's this Dave guy, and why does he have his own Republic?
topics.response_text: He's the president of the Republic of Dave, duh. You can ask over at the Museum of Dave if you don't believe me.

topics.topic_text: Actually, I think I have all the info I need.
Have you considered running for the presidency?
topics.response_text: I'm too young!  I can't even vote yet.

topics.topic_text: Have you heard the election results?
topics.response_text: Did Dave win it again? I'd have voted for him if they'd let me.

topics.topic_text: Your Republic is forfeit. Prepare to be reclaimed by the Wasteland!
I'd like to know more about the Republic.
topics.response_text: Um, okay. As long as President Daddy says it's all right.

topics.topic_text: That's all I need to know.
What's your take on the Republic?
topics.response_text: Everyone says that daddy is the best man, ever ever. I don't know, but that's what Shawna says, so I guess it's true.

topics.topic_text: Tell me more about this Dave guy.
topics.response_text: Daddy? He's not so bad. Shawna says he's the most important man to ever walk the Wastes.
That's what President Daddy says, but I only remember having the one mommy before.

topics.topic: RDTopicYourselfWhat can you tell me about yourself?
topics.topic_text: So, what have you been up to, kid?
topics.response_text: I like to play with the toys in the museum, but Shawna always yells at me.

conversation.response_text: Have you heard about Dave, lady?
Ugh why can't I just vote now?
President Daddy, there is a Wastelander who wishes to see you, sir!
Can't right now. Why don't you ask Mary?
But I already know everything about Dave...
I thought grandpa Tom just gave Dave the Republic...
But I thought grandpa just got really, really old...
It wasn't very long ago... I think I remember...
Why am I always picked on in class? Make someone else do it!
Why does Daddy need merits? Can't he just be Daddy?

description:
Rachael is a 11 year-old Caucasian Female.

Rachael is an energetic 11-year-old girl with bright, curious eyes and a constant smile. She's known throughout the Republic of Dave as the President's daughter, always eager to greet newcomers and share her knowledge of the settlement's rules. Rachael wears a simple, clean dress and keeps her blonde hair tied back with a ribbon.

Rachael's Personality: Rachael is inquisitive, enthusiastic, and remarkably well-behaved for a child growing up in the wasteland. She takes her role as the President's daughter seriously and has memorized all of 'President Daddy's' rules. She's friendly toward outsiders but becomes defensive if anyone criticizes her father or the Republic. She has a childlike wonder about the pre-war world and loves hearing stories from travelers.

Rachael's Backstory: Born and raised in the Republic of Dave, Rachael has never known life outside this small settlement. Her mother passed away when she was young, leaving her and her father, Dave, to run the republic together. Though she's only 11, Rachael already understands the importance of Dave's leadership and takes pride in her position as his daughter. She spends her days attending the makeshift school in the town hall, helping with simple chores, and greeting visitors to the Republic.
